channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024051334
item.description:
Report X-2024051334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY A LOADER ON THE SD-1/2, DOOR 106. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2024051700
item.description:
Report X-2024051700

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR OBSERVED WET OUTER CARTON CORNER ON FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE. HAZMAT RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SCENE. CARTON WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP WORK AREA FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION, LOOSE CAP WAS NOTED, RESULTING IN SPILLAGE. CONTENTS WERE PROCESSED FOLLOWING DMP/DMN PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report E-2024050688
item.description:
Report E-2024050688

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 23, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 had faulty packaging and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel observed the material evaporated prior to their arrival. Crews placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum.
